text.div: National Children's Digital Health Collaborative CapabilityStatement (Consumer)

name: National Children's Digital Health Collaborative CapabilityStatement (Consumer)
title: National Children's Digital Health Collaborative CapabilityStatement (Consumer)
description: Capability Statement for National Children's Digital Health Collaborative Consumer Channel

rest.documentation: Capability Statement for National Children's Digital Health Collaborative

security.description: NCDHC FHIR server uses standard OAuth 2.0 for Consumer interactions. Consumer interactsion are supported by Smart-On-FHIR Launch sequences

resource.documentation: Provide details on what can be done on the Person resource

interaction.documentation: Reads a Patient instance based on the input Person.id
When a client searches Person with no search criteria, they get a list of all Person instances they have access too. Servers may elect to offer additional search parameters, but this is not required

searchParam.name: identifier
searchParam.documentation: A Person identifier. 'family', 'gender', 'birthdate' is mandatory when searched with identifier

searchParam.name: given
searchParam.documentation: A portion of the family name of the Person. This is mandatory and allowed when searched using identifier. FHIR type is string

searchParam.name: family
searchParam.documentation: A portion of the given name of the Person. This can only be provided when searched with identifier.

searchParam.name: birthdate
searchParam.documentation: The Person's date of birth. only 'eq' is supporrted. This is mandatory and allowed when searched using identifier.

searchParam.name: gender
searchParam.documentation: Gender of the Person. This is mandator and allowed when searched using identifier.

resource.documentation: Provide details on what can be done on the RelatedPerson resource

interaction.documentation: Reads a RelatedPerson instance based on the input RelatedPerson.id

resource.documentation: Provide details on what can be done on the Patient resource

interaction.documentation: Reads a Patient instance based on the input Patient.id
When a client searches patients with no search criteria, they get a list of all patients they have access too. Servers may elect to offer additional search parameters, but this is not required

searchParam.name: identifier
searchParam.documentation: A patient identifier. 'family', 'gender', 'birthdate' is mandatory when searched with identifier

searchParam.name: given
searchParam.documentation: A portion of the family name of the patient. This is mandatory and allowed when searched using identifier. FHIR type is string

searchParam.name: family
searchParam.documentation: A portion of the given name of the patient. This can only be provided when searched with identifier.

searchParam.name: birthdate
searchParam.documentation: The patient's date of birth. only 'eq' is supporrted. This is mandatory and allowed when searched using identifier.

searchParam.name: gender
searchParam.documentation: Gender of the patient. This is mandator and allowed when searched using identifier.

resource.documentation: Provide details on what can be done on the Consent resource

interaction.documentation: Searches Consent instances based on the search criteria provided

searchParam.name: category
searchParam.documentation: Classification of the consent statement - for indexing/retrieval

searchParam.name: consentor
searchParam.documentation: Who is agreeing to the policy and rules

searchParam.name: date
searchParam.documentation: When this Consent was created or indexed

resource.documentation: Provide details on what can be done on the AuditEvent resource

interaction.documentation: Searches AuditEvent instances based on the search criteria provided

searchParam.name: patient
searchParam.documentation: Patient reference for which the AuditEvent instances should be fetched

searchParam.name: date
searchParam.documentation: Time when the event was recorded. System SHALL support 'ge', 'le' and 'eq' search as per FHIR standard

searchParam.name: action
searchParam.documentation: Type of action performed during the event
